title: Introducing the Distinguished Members
body:
Hey everyone,

You may have seen a few purple names floating around and wondering what that's all about. The summoners in purple are known as Distinguished Members on the boards. Think of them as positive and helpful members that are on their way to becoming full fledged boards volunteers =D
---
Edited in a clearer definition to help avoid confusion
These summoners have been recognised as always being helpful, constructive and positive forces on boards. Quality over quantity applies greatly here.

They are not volunteers in a specific capacity (like the emissaries), but rather the title exists as a recognition of contribution and some visibility to those who strive to create a constructive and friendly environment on boards.
---
They are always floating around chatting and hopefully being helpful =) so make sure to say hi to them and introduce yourself.

Current Distinguished Members are;
[Nijiiyo](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/miscellaneous/GLk0EEmq-introducing-the-distinguished-members?comment=000100000000)
[Lord Sesshomaru](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/miscellaneous/oblohAe0-distinguished-member-update?comment=0000)
Heartvine

replies.body: I find it funny how it's always the people that are never seen on the boards that get these positions over others who are present in almost every single board post
Sometimes its about quality over quantity =)

I check in every 2-3 minutes every single day (Yes I have no life) and I have never heard of Glow and have maybe seen Nijiyo in about 3 or 4 posts with the last one being maybe around a month ago. Still find it quite funny but meh

_"I have never heard of Glow and have maybe seen Nijiyo in about 3 or 4 posts"_

+ That's exactly why we wanted to get this system out there! 

 There's some really exceptional contributors to the boards, but they hardly get noticed at all sometimes. Hopefully with the distinguished members tag we'll be able to change that a little :D

Some hardcore board members might also argue that these people don't post much, but that's actually not criteria we were really considering when choosing these summoners. 

It's always possible to increase the quantity of posts someone makes with ease, however, increasing the quality of their posts is far harder and might not always work out.

I'll definitely keep what you said in mind though for when we select the next group of Distinguished Members.

Riot said they'd keep an eye out for good people on the boards and choose a few  to become "special" volunteers yet the people they always select haven't even existed on the boards. So how is it fair that they get the positions over people who constantly post, reply and actually contribute to discussions as well as help out others in need?

Do you have someone specific in mind who you think really deserved this? 

We're actually in charge of recruiting for this role, not **Riot**. I want to expand this to include more people within a year so I'm very open to any suggestions :D

Cheesyleeks, Lord Sesshomaru, Talon12, RogueStoney and myself (Although I think Riot dislikes me and the stuff I post) are all the most common and active users on the boards who most frequently post/answer questions and give their opinions on ideas and creations. If you had to choose anyone it should be among these lot as they rightfully deserve it.

My bad, we should have really defined what the DMs represent. I'm working on an official definition to add to the post now. Sorry :(

To clarify though, DMs are not frequent posters or very active board users. _They are summoners who mainly post really constructive, positive, and insightful content._

While I really enjoy having all you guys on the boards, I think you might be more skilled in the art of dank memes most days than being insightful and deep in your opinions. Not that it's wrong to post like that obviously, it's just not DM material.

But for the record, I have considered **Lord Sesshomaru**, there's just a few things holding him back. Anyone going for the role should feel free to ask any of us what they need to work on to be considered a possible DM.

I hope that clarified things a little.

Hey, I'm happy to be thought of in the considerations process ^^
Thanks for thinking of me.

So what's holding me back? I can think of a few things for sure... 
but it'd be great to hear exactly what i need to work on :)

Just so you know, what I think isn't the end of the line. DMs are selected democratically, so even if I think you're awesome, there might be some others who think you're not quite there yet.

Anyway, here's 2 big issues for me:

1. This might come off as petty, but formatting and grammar is crucial to have IMO.

 [Posts like this ](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-strategy/2mrdadUK-yasuo-needs-a-rework-huge-ass-nerf-or-something-along-those-lines?comment=0000) have good content, but the formatting is horrendous! Making big informative posts is great, but it's equally important that they look appealing to read.

2.  You come off as a little passive-aggressive sometimes.

 I know you're probably joking most of the time, but I really can't approve anyone as a DM if you're being rude to other players.

If you need help fixing those problems or want some feedback on how you're doing, you're always welcome to ask us :)

Awesome, thanks for that man! :)

I had and do have no expectations of being selected, as I'm sure there are those that would be far better than I, (but i certainly wouldn't be unhappy tho haha)

But i am interested in improving the community, and to my shame I have been rude on more than one occasion, but recently Ive noticed my own behaviour and decided that it most certainly isn't the best way to be, _(for myself as well as the community)_ So I'm putting that to an end for sure.

And yea i most definitely agree with the formatting and grammar haha, ill make sure to work on that xD

thanks for the feedback man :)

Well that's not exactly what I meant, the guys I listed (including myself) do indeed post stuff frequently that does reflect more on the comical side of things however when more serious topics are brought up I can assure you we are very insightful into what we talk about. I can't really provide evidence or good examples just what I've seen over the months that I've been on here but if that's what you ultimately decide I shall see about becoming more _constructive_ and  _positive_ in the future.

We do have to be overly harsh on who gets in sometimes because we'd rather avoid the drama of removing someone's DM flair. 

Your good work doesn't go unnoticed though! I really like some of your comments on gameplay posts (specifically [this one](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/miscellaneous/P0LEEaft-yasuo-discussion?comment=0006 )).

However your current nominations, while I do see them alot, some aint fit for the job. Cheesyleeks is proud shitposter, shessh is a proud Yasuo hate azir love shitposter iirc. I dont come here alot (1 or 2 times a day at the most) but i dont think ive ever seen your name either? 

I agree on Talon12 and Stoney definitely. I always see them in threads, and their comments usually contribute to discussion or the better of the OP in some way. And i recognise stoney from forums so hes a bit of a veteran init.

While I do agree Cheesey is quite the memelord on the boards, I would disagree about Sesshomaru. While he does complain a lot about the game in a lot of his posts, I will admit that he brings up a few interesting topics and conversation to the boards, which is something we need. If you haven't seen me it might be because I generally avoid posts that are: Recruiting (LFT, LFC, LFM), Directed at Riot and other questions I cannot answer or talk about because I don't have enough knowledge on the topic.
